sep.gaia.util

Class AlgoUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • sep.gaia.util.AlgoUtil

  • public final class AlgoUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that provides converting methods between different States (such as GLState, TileState, GeoState).
    Author:
    Johannes Bauer, Matthias Fisch

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float[][] IDENTITY 
      static float TILE_LENGTH_IN_PIXELS
      Amount of pixels a tile should have in window-coordinate-space.

    • Method Detail

      • geoToGL

        public static FloatVector3D geoToGL(FloatVector3D geoVector)
        Converts a given vector of which the first two coordinates represent a position and the third one a zoom level in geographic coordinates into a vector of which the first two coordinates represent a matching position and zoom in GL-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        geoVector - the vector to be converted
        Returns:
        the converted vector in GL-coordinates which is of the form (x-position, y-position, zoom)

      • tileToGL

        public static FloatVector3D tileToGL(IntegerVector3D tileVector)
        Converts a IntegerVector3D object which represents a position on the map and a zoom level in tile coordinates into a FloatVector3D object that represents the same position and the same zoom level in GL-coordinates. The position is represented in the first two coordinates and the zoom level in the third one. Because a zoom level is always greater than or equal to 0 in tile coordinates, in the case of the given zoom level being smaller than 0 null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        tileVector - the vector in tile coordinates that represents a position on the map in the first two coordinates and a zoom level in the third one
        Returns:
        a vector in GL-coordinates that matches tileVector and null if and only if tileVector is null or the third coordinate of it is smaller than 0

      • glToTile

        public static IntegerVector3D glToTile(FloatVector3D glVector)
        Converts a FloatVector3D object which represents a position on the map and a zoom level in GL-coordinates into an IntegerVector3D object that represents the same position and the same zoom level in tile coordinates. The position is represented in the first two coordinates and the zoom level in the third one. Because a zoom level is always strictly greater than 0 in the GL-representation, in the case of the given zoom level being smaller or equal to 0 null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        glVector - the vector in GL-coordinates that represents a position on the map in the first two coordinates and a zoom level in the third one
        Returns:
        a vector in tile coordinates that matches glVector and null if and only if glVector is null or the third coordinate of it is smaller or equal to 0

      • geoToTile

        public static IntegerVector3D geoToTile(FloatVector3D geoVector)
        Converts a FloatVector3D object which represents a position on the map and a zoom level in geographic coordinates into an IntegerVector3D object that represents the same position and the same zoom level in tile coordinates. The position is represented in the first two coordinates and the zoom level in the third one. Because a zoom level is always strictly greater than 0 in geographic coordinates, in the case of the given zoom level being smaller or equal to 0 null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        geoVector - the vector in geographic coordinates that represents a position on the map in the first two coordinates and a zoom level in the third one
        Returns:
        a vector in tile coordinates that matches geoVector and null if and only if geoVector is null or the third coordinate of it is smaller or equal to 0

      • glToGeo

        public static FloatVector3D glToGeo(FloatVector3D glVector)
        Converts a given vector of which the first two coordinates represent a position and the third one a zoom level in GL-coordinates into a vector of which the first two coordinates represent a matching position and zoom in geographic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        glVector - the vector in GL-coordinates to be converted
        Returns:
        a converted vector in geographic coordinates, which has the form (longitude, latitude, zoom)

      • tileToGeo

        public static FloatVector3D tileToGeo(IntegerVector3D tileVector)
        Converts a IntegerVector3D object which represents a position on the map and a zoom level in tile coordinates into a FloatVector3D object that represents the same position and the same zoom level in geographic coordinates. The position is represented in the first two coordinates and the zoom level in the third one. Because a zoom level is always greater than or equal to 0 in tile coordinates, in the case of the given zoom level being smaller than 0 null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        tileVector - the vector in tile coordinates that represents a position on the map in the first two coordinates and a zoom level in the third one
        Returns:
        a vector in geographic coordinates that matches tileVector and null if and only if tileVector is null or the third coordinate of it is smaller than 0

        public static FloatVector3D glToFloatTile(FloatVector3D glVector)

        public static FloatVector3D glToFloatTile(FloatBoundingBox glBox)

      • geoToFloatTile

        public static FloatVector3D geoToFloatTile(FloatVector3D geoVector)

      • geoToGL

        public static FloatBoundingBox geoToGL(FloatBoundingBox geoBox)
        Converts a bounding box in geographic coordinates where the first two coordinates of each corner vectors represent a position and the third one a zoom level into a matching bounding box in GL-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        geoBox - the geographic bounding box to be converted, it is assumed to form a valid rectangle
        Returns:
        a bounding box in GL-coordinates that matches geoBox or null if geoBox is null

      • geoToTile

        public static IntegerBoundingBox geoToTile(FloatBoundingBox geoBox)
        Converts a given bounding box in geographic coordinates (degree) into an equivalent bounding box in tile coordinates.
        Parameters:
        geoBox - the bounding box in geographic coordinates, which is expected to form a valid rectangle
        Returns:
        a bounding box in tile coordinates that matches geoBox, or null if and only if geoBox is null

      • glToGeo

        public static FloatBoundingBox glToGeo(FloatBoundingBox glBox)
        Converts a bounding box in GL-coordinates where the first two coordinates of each corner vectors represent a position and the third one a zoom level into a matching bounding box in geographic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        glBox - the GL-bounding box to be converted, it is assumed to form a valid rectangle
        Returns:
        a bounding box in geographic coordinates that matches geoBox of null if glBox is null

      • glToTile

        public static IntegerBoundingBox glToTile(FloatBoundingBox glBox,
                          float glZoom)
        Converts a given bounding box in GL-coordinates into an equivalent bounding box in tile coordinates.
        Parameters:
        glBox - the bounding box in GL-coordinates, which is expected to be a valid rectangle
        glZoom - the current zoom level which is needed for the conversion
        Returns:
        a bounding box in tile-coordinates that matches glBox, or null if and only if the given bounding box is null

      • tileToGeo

        public static FloatBoundingBox tileToGeo(IntegerBoundingBox tileBox)
        Converts a given bounding box in tile coordinates into an equivalent bounding box in geographic coordinates (degree).
        Parameters:
        tileBox - a bounding box in tile coordinates, which is expected to be a valid rectangle
        Returns:
        a matching bounding box in geographic coordinates, or null if and only if the passed bounding box is null

      • tileToGL

        public static FloatBoundingBox tileToGL(IntegerBoundingBox tileBox)
        Converts a bounding box given in tile coordinates into an equivalent bounding box in GL-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        tileBox - the bounding box in tile coordinates which is expected to be a valid rectangle
        Returns:
        the converted bounding box in GL-coordinates, or null if and only if null is given as bounding box

      • tileToGLBox

        public static FloatBoundingBox tileToGLBox(IntegerVector3D tileVector)
        Converts a given 3d-integer-vector of which the first two coordinates represent a position in tile coordinates and the third one a zoom level in tile coordinates, into a bounding box in GL-coordinates of which the upper left corner matches the given vector.
        Parameters:
        tileCoords - a vector in tile coordinates, representing position and a zoom level
        Returns:
        a rectangle in GL-coordinates of which tileCoords matches the upper left corner

      • geoToGL

        public static void geoToGL(GeoState geoState,
           GLState glState)
        Converts the coordinates from geoState into GL-coordinates and saves them in glState
        Parameters:
        geoState - the state from which the data is taken
        glState - the state to be updated

      • glToTile

        public static void glToTile(GLState glState,
            TileState tileState)
        Converts the available coordinates from glState into tile coordinates and updates tileState with those new values.
        Parameters:
        glState - the state from which the information is taken
        tileState - the state to be updated

      • geoToTile

        public static void geoToTile(GeoState geoState,
             TileState tileState)
        Converts the coordinates from geoState into tile coordinates and updates tileState with them.
        Parameters:
        geoState - the state from which the data is taken
        tileState - the state to be updated

      • glToGeo

        public static void glToGeo(GLState glState,
           GeoState geoState)
        Updates the given GeoState object by converting all the available information from GLState into geographic coordinates.
        Parameters:
        glState - the state from which the data is used
        geoState - the state to be updated

      • glToTileZoom

        public static int glToTileZoom(float glZoom)
        Converts a given positive number representing a zoom level in GL-coordinates into a zoom level for tile coordinates.
        Parameters:
        glZoom - the zoom level to be converted
        Returns:
        a value in the range of 1-TileState.MAX_ZOOM representing a zoom level in tile coordinates

      • tileToGLZoom

        public static float tileToGLZoom(float tileZoom)
        Converts a given non-negative number representing a zoom level in tile coordinates into a zoom level in GL-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        tileZoom - the zoom level to be converted
        Returns:
        a zoom level in GL-coordinates

      • isTileBBoxSuperposed

        public static boolean isTileBBoxSuperposed(IntegerBoundingBox a,
                           IntegerBoundingBox b)

      • glCoordsPerPixelRange

        public static float glCoordsPerPixelRange(int pixels,
                          int tileZoom)
        Returns the length of a vertical or horizontal range in window-coordinate-space in GL-coordinates.
        Parameters:
        pixels - The length of the range in pixels (window-space).
        tileZoom - The zoom-level to calculate the length for.
        Returns:
        The length of the range in GL-coordinates.

      • glCoordsPerPixelRange

        public static float glCoordsPerPixelRange(int pixels,
                          float canvasPixelRange,
                          float canvasRange)

      • rotateAroundZ

        public static FloatVector3D rotateAroundZ(FloatVector3D vec,
                          float angle)
        Rotates the passed Vector around the Z-Axis.
        Parameters:
        vec - The Vector to be rotated. It won't be changed.
        angle - The angle around which the FloatVector3D vecwill be rotated.
        Returns:
        A vector rotated around angle which origin coordinates where specified by vec.

      • getTileCoordsInGLBBox

        public static java.util.Collection<IntegerVector3D> getTileCoordsInGLBBox(FloatBoundingBox bbox,
                                                          float step,
                                                          int tileZoom)
        Takes a GL-bounding-box and returns the tile-coordinates of all those tiles that are contained fully or partially in the bounding-box.
        Parameters:
        bbox - The bounding-box to get tile-coordinates for.
        step - The distance checked for tiles in. This should be less or equal to the side-length of a tile to get all tiles contained in the box.
        tileZoom - The tile-zoom of the tiles to check for.
        Returns:
        The tile-coordinates of all those tiles that are contained fully or partially in the bounding-box.

      • calculateGeoDistance

        public static float calculateGeoDistance(FloatVector3D from,
                         FloatVector3D to)
        Calculates the distance between two geo-positions.
        Parameters:
        from - The position to start from.
        to - The destination.
        Returns:
        The distance between from and to in kilometers.
